Prompts.Prompt: Researching factual information (e.g., “who was the first president of France?”, “how many countries use the euro?”)
Looking for current events or recent updates (e.g., “what’s going on in Canada today?”, “any news on the wildfires?”, “what’s in today’s paper?”)
Looking for something that could be found online (e.g., “Any steam promotions?”, “Can you look online?”)
Technical help or anything related to coding, programming, or software (e.g., “what’s wrong with this Python code?”, “how to fix a null reference error?”)
Learning or trying to understand general (non-coding) concepts (e.g., “how does the stock market work?”, “what is entropy?”)
General conversation or open-ended chatting (e.g., “what’s on your mind?”, “let’s talk”, “how was your day?”)

ParsePromptInstructions: Which one of those affirmations represent best the user intent. Return 1 if affirmation one, 2 if affirmation. Return only a number 1 or 2 no explanation.
